# STATIC ROUTES AND THE DEFAULT GATEWAY
https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_enterprise_linux/6/html/deployment_guide/s1-networkscripts-static-routes

/etc/resolv.conf {
	# Generated by NetworkManager
	search cdc.health.local prod.health.local
	nameserver 192.168.160.10
	nameserver 192.168.60.20
	#nameserver 192.168.160.40
}

/etc/sysconfig/network-scripts/ifcfg- {
	DEVICE=
	TYPE=
	ONBOOT=
	IPADDR=
	PREFIX=
	GATEWAY=
	NM_CONTROLLED=
	ZONE=
}

/etc/sysconfig/network-scripts/route- {
	default via 192.168.60.254 dev eth0
	10.10.10.0/24 via 192.168.0.10 dev eth0
	172.16.1.10/32 via 192.168.0.10 dev eth0
}

/etc/sysconfig/network {
	NETWORKING=boolean
		A Boolean to enable (yes) or disable (no) networking.
	HOSTNAME=value
		The host name of the machine.
	GATEWAY=value
		The IP address of the network's gateway.
		default gateway when there is no GATEWAY directive in an interface's ifcfg file.
	NM_BOND_VLAN_ENABLED=boolean
		A Boolean to allow (yes) or disallow (no) the NetworkManager application from detecting and managing bonding, bridging, and VLAN interfaces.

	examples {
		HOSTNAME=KUTLLDOMLDAP
		NETWORKING=yes
		NETWORKING_IPV6=no	
	}

}

# SET SYSTEM-WIDE PROXY
/etc/profile
~/.bashrc
export http_proxy="http://USER:PASSWORD@PROXY_SERVER:PORT"
export https_proxy="https://USER:PASSWORD@PROXY_SERVER:PORT"
export ftp_proxy="http://USER:PASSWORD@PROXY_SERVER:PORT"
